name: Sophomore Review Portfolio
description: The sophomore review portfolio is a collection of work students should have completed for courses that they typically take by the end of the sophomore year. Faculty review this portfolio to ensure the student progressing as expected.

categories.name: At least two studio art samples
categories.description: Provide at least two work samples you completed during ART-1110, ART-1230, and/or ART-2230.

categories.name: At least two software skills samples
categories.description: Provide at least two work samples you completed during VCD-1100 and/or VCD-1150.

categories.name: At least two other coursework samples
categories.description: Provide at least two samples of your work from other classes you've taken in this program to date such as from VCD-2200 Typography, VCD-2400 Graphic Design I, or VCD-2600 Web Design I.

categories.name: Other work (optional)
categories.description: (Optional) Provide other work samples that evidence skills relevant to this major.
